description.narrative:
Help lower an IDA countrys dependence on thermal power: Currently, non-renewable sources account for over 60% of Honduras annual power generation. The successful completion of the Project will provide clean, low-cost power generated from a renewable resource to meet close to 2.6% of the countrys current power demand and allow for the possible retirement of old, inefficient and more expensive thermal capacity.
Development of Honduras hydroelectric resources: To address the countrys current energy challenges, the Government of Honduras ("GON") has put forth a strategy to develop its domestic renewable energy resources, including hydropower. Successful completion of the largest private sector-led hydroelectric project in Honduras to date would contribute directly, as well as indirectly through demonstration effect, to this objective.
Climate change: The Project is expected to displace thermal power generation, hence reducing the regions carbon emissions by approximately 108 thousand tons of CO2 per year.
Supporting the financial sustainability of the power sector: The Project will reduce Honduraswholesale energy prices and dependence on oil, supporting the power sectors path towards financial sustainability.
Cost Efficiency: The Project will help lower the cost of electricity and therefore help support a lower cost structure for industries and consumers in Honduras.

The La Vegona power project comprises a 38.5 MW run-of-the-river hydroelectric development on the Humuya or Comayagua River, 8 kilometers downstream from the existing 300MW Francisco Morazan (El Cajon) hydroelectric project. The Project is expected to produce an average of approximately 172 GWh per annum. The Project will sell electricity to industrial clients as well as the state-owned utility ENEE under long-term power purchase agreements (PPA).
The Project is being developed by Compañía Hondureña de Energía Renovable S.A. de C.V. (COHERSA or the Company), a Honduran company created for the purpose of developing the Project.

name.narrative:
The Project is located between the Yoro and Cortes Departments on the Humuya or Comayagua River, approximately 8 km downstream from the 300 MW Francisco Morazan (El Cajon) hydroelectric project. The main structures of the project would be located about 20 km northeast of the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, in the Department of Cortes in northwestern Honduras.
The Project includes the construction of a concrete gravity dam 110 meters in length and a rockfill-clay core dam of 230 meters. The concrete structure will include the spillways and the powerhouse. A transmission line of 3.6 km will be constructed to the El Cajón-El Progreso (230 kV) line. The project requires no tunneling.
